title-group.article-title: A Model of the Aeroelastic Behavior of Darrieus Wind Turbine Blades

abstract.p: The aeroelastic analysis of the blades of a Darrieus wind turbine is fairly complicated. It is affected by structural, aerodynamic, inertia and gravitational parameters. These four contributions are highly coupled. Because the phenomenon is not axisymmetric, the behaviour of each blade is periodic and thus unsteady effects become important. The paper presents a model for analysing the nonlinear coupled aeroelastic behavior of the blades of a Darrieus wind turbine. The model is general, capable of dealing with any distribution of blade properties (mass, structural and aerodynamic), any blade geometry and any combination of boundary conditions. The solution procedure is based on the Galerkin method. The whole model is nonlinear, thus requiring an iterative solution procedure. The present theoretical model is compared with available theoretical and experimental results from the literature.
